titles.title: South Maui Coastal Preservation Act of 2003
To direct the Secretary of the Interior to study the suitability and feasibility of designating certain lands along the southern coast of Maui, Hawaii, as a unit of the National Park System.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.

bill.summary: 11/20/2003--Introduced. South Maui Coastal Preservation Act of 2003 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to study the feasibility of designating certain lands on the southern coast of Maui, Hawaii, extending from the Ahihi-Kinau Natural Area Reserve to Kanaloa Point, as a unit of the National Park System.
